snippet: Young people who want to choose their own mates face the harsh reality that strict social traditions still trump new laws and expanded rights — and that honor killings in such cases remain endemic.
abstract: Story of Zakia and Mohammad Ali illustrates brutal obstacles faced by young people in Afghanistan who want to choose their own mates; strict local traditions continue to trump new laws and expanded rights; Zakia has taken refuge in a women's shelter as couple tries to find a way to be together, suffering intimidation, beatings and the very real threat of honor killings, which remain endemic in such cases.
lead_paragraph: Young people who want to choose their own mates face the harsh reality that strict social traditions still trump new laws and expanded rights — and that honor killings in such cases remain endemic.

headline.main: 2 Star-Crossed Afghans Cling to Love, Even at Risk of Death
headline.print_headline: 2 Star-Crossed Afghans Cling to Love, Even at Risk of Death
